greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number (with repetition) of (not necessarily distinct) substrings in the binary representation of n that each occur multiple times.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
example: 0,0,1,1,10,10 each occur multiple times in binary 1010 = decimal 10. So a(10) = 6.
mathematica: Array[Function[d, Total@ Select[Tally@ Apply[Join, Map[Partition[d, #, 1] &, Range[Length@ d - 1]]], Last@ # > 1 &][[All, -1]]]@ IntegerDigits[#, 2] &, 83] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 23 2017 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Jun 24 2008
